result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Kincole McDougle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis Stats to apply for work, treatment, and schooling.

Consecutive to: any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

Obtain GED/HSED.
Maintain full time/part time employment and or schooling.
As a convicted felon defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.

Electronic monitoring.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.
MUST provide a DNA sample.
As a convicted felon defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.
Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Progam and any other programs ordered by the Department and or the agent.

timeConds.notes:
12-10-15/ Judge Carolina M Stark
The Court ordered that the defendant serve 45 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit and with a strong objection to electronic monitoring, as condition time in the HOC for non-compliance with the terms of his Probation in this case beginning on 10-05-15.
This order supersedes and replaces that Order for Commitment for Condition Time issued on 11-06-15.
*************************
11-06-15/Judge Carolina M Stark
Defendant violated conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered that the defendant spend 45 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC.
********************

Court STAYED the sentence to be used as sanction time at the discretion of the agent. Serve 45 days at the House of Correction/Day Reporting Center with Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work treatment, and schooling.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny Kincole McDougle

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Reflects 12-10-15 Court order imposing 45 days of condition time
(the 11-06-15 order is also reflected on this JOC).
Second Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions, received and filed. tk
Letter in response to defendant's request for sentence credit.
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit.
Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions, signed and filed.
Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and forwarded to Br. 17, Judge Stark, for review.  jm

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ X ]   Review / Modification Request / Recommended
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction / Day Reporting Center, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work, treatment, and schooling.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS
with the following conditions:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  Electronic monitoring.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.
*  Obtain GED/HSED.
*  MUST provide a DNA sample.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program and any other programs ordered by the Department and or the agent.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 45 DAYS at the House of Correction / Day Reporting Center with Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work treatment, and schooling.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence to to be used as sanction time at the discretion of the agent.

Received and filed with court:
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Johnny Kincole McDougle in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for Paul Hauer for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point report addressed; defendant warned to remain in compliance with monitoring.

Defendant Johnny Kincole McDougle in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defense withdraws its Motion to Suppress.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State Response to Defendant's Motion

Defendant Johnny Kincole McDougle in court with attorney Alejandro Lockwood for attorney Debra J Patterson.  Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also present Justice Point caseworker Mason Lavey.  FILE NOT IN COURT.  Justice Point report addressed; defendant is not in compliance with conditions of bail.  Court declines to amend bail at this time.  Defendant admonished regarding drug use.  

Case remains scheduled for motion hearing on 5-27-14, 1:30 p.m.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO SUPPRESS FRUITS OF ILLEGAL SEARCH

Defendant Johnny Kincole McDougle in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Motion hearing scheduled for 05-27-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnny Kincole McDougle in court with Trisha Fritz, student intern under the supervision of attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Johnny Kincole McDougle in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Sergio Rentas-MPD Officer. Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #07CF5961 that are attached to the complaint.     Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Case set for Scheduling Conference on April 23, 2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Johnny Kincole McDougle in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Johnny Kincole McDougle in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
